pages.text: $(major)DNA Helices/$ contain genetic information. This can be either in the form of a $(l:geneticsresequenced:genes)Gene/$, or an $(minor)Entity/$.$(br2)Freshly crafted, a DNA Helix contains only the Entity that the DNA came from.

pages.title: Encrypted DNA Helix
pages.text: This DNA Helix contains the genetic information of a $(minor)Cow/$, but the actual Gene it has is $(bad)unknown/$. To decrypt it, you'll need to pass it through a $(l:geneticsresequenced:blocks/dna_decryptor)DNA Decryptor/$.

pages.title: Decrypted DNA Helix
pages.text: This DNA Helix has been decrypted, and now we can see it contains the $(l:geneticsresequenced:genes/milky)Milky/$ Gene.

pages.title: Basic Gene
pages.text: DNA Helices have a chance of being $(minor)Basic/$. This means that they $(bad)don't contain any Gene/$, but they can still contribute to $(l:geneticsresequenced:items/plasmid)Plasmids/$.
